24.title: iPhone 15 Pro DRAMA!
24.description: There's a lot of drama surrounding the new iPhone 15 Pro from the glass back breaking, to the titanium holding in more heat, and ...
24.captions: these are videos I usually don't make because I find that controversy surrounding the iPhone release week every year turn out to be more smoke than Fire And there's usually a week of people complaining about small minute things that really don't turn out to be real issues but this year the iPhone 15 Pro seems to be gathering a specific amount of controversy that has tuned up to the point where I have seen countless tweets videos tick tocks you name it discussing all of these issues from the iPhone 15 Pro Max breaking too easily to it thermally getting way too hot and you know people basically blaming issues on the design of the iPhone 15 Pro particularly with Apple's choice to switch over to Titanium instead of using the stainless steel design that they did on the old iPhone 14 pro now listen unlike most people I am here to tell you I don't know everything I don't claim to be the final word on if the iPhone 15 Pro or Pro Max has issues or maybe even in the future some major design compromise flaw that even hasn't been on Earth yet might come to light and there may be a bunch of issues with this phone but right now I'm just seeing a lot of unqualified opinions floating around the internet and these controversies have boiled over to the point where my own audience is now commenting on my videos or dming me and asking me if they should avoid the purchase of the iPhone 15 Pro because of the current issues and unlike usual Apple iPhone discussions which stay pretty rooted in the Tech Community there's been enough spillover this year that I've seen people like penguin zero who's a pretty popular YouTuber and he only has slightly better hair than me talking about iPhone durability and making spurious yes I do know big words spurious claims that modern Apple products compared to old Apple products meanwhile if you get a modern Apple product there's a chance it stops working within the first week before we even dive into the supposed issues on the iPhone 15 Pro I gotta tackle this argument right away and that's basically the tired argument that things back in the day were built better and listen you can objectively look at this thing you don't have to use personal or anecdotal bias or evidence like he does older iPhones had far more issues than modern day iPhones they didn't last as long they didn't get as much many software updates they were more prone to Breaking the iPhone 4 literally had the biggest quality control Scandal ever on an iPhone with its antenna gate issue and the iPhone 4 strangely enough was also the first iPhone to feature a full glass back and that glass back back then was so prone to shattering uh it was Infamous for it and you know it's it's no coincidence that the iPhone 5 switched to a mostly aluminum back uh just two years after the original iPhone 4 design and if you look at modern day iPhones even this iPhone 15 Pro which people are complaining about the glass back they are objectively much stronger than they were back then so that argument is already done it's not even worth mentioning anymore and also you think you can come over just like that Charlie you can let me tell you something I worked my ass off to get where I am and you think you can take these shortcuts and you think suddenly you're my peer you do what I do because you're funny and you can make people laugh I committed my life to this you don't slide into it like a cheap pair of slippers and reap all the rewards anyway because of all this attention about the iPhone 15 Pro and so many dubious claims I feel obligated to comment on these controversies with my own experience and my own take on what's important because I feel like I should explain the issues with some of these controversies to my viewers to let them know if they are actual issues that you need to be worried about to stop you from purchasing this device first off let's start with durability claims as I believe this one has skyrocketed to the top of the reasons why people are afraid to buy an iPhone 15 Pro they're they're fearful that they're going to buy it and it's going to break it's a reasonable fear to have now of course there's been a few drop test videos uploaded to YouTube already but I think the most infamous video is from jerryrig everything where he does his usual smartphone torture tests uh which every iPhone survived I might know including the iPhone 15 Pro the only one that really failed it was the iPhone 15 Pro Max which had the glass back shatter when he tried to do a bend test now if this little controversy sounds familiar to you it's because this thing is spreading in a similar fashion to the now Infamous iPhone 6 Bengay controversy again I think the glass shattering on the back is probably a Better Built phone than the iPhone 6 bending things weren't necessarily built better back then again just pointing that out there but in general this video has sparked people just reusing this image and talking about how the iPhone 15 Pro is more fragile compared to last year's 14 pro now listen will your iPhone 15 Pro Max glass shatter if you try and physically bend it I don't know but as a normal user I don't think you're ever gonna try and do that normally I discount these bend test videos anyway because no one in the real world is willingly going to take their phone and try and bend it as hard as they can I know I'm not right now even though I'm you know giving you the visual of it and listen most people aren't trained assassins that can kill you just by applying their thumbs to pressure points on your body like Jerry rig everything so that guy has unnatural strength that's a joke now drop tests are usually more of an indication of real world durability we all drop our phones from time to time and there's a fair share of drop test videos out there which also show the glass breaking much easier than the iPhone 14 Pros back now these videos seem pretty reasonable but I do think there's also a flaw with them as well because I think most drop test videos do a poor job usually um showing real world scenarios again of how people drop their phones usually these are you know just phones dropping flat onto concrete and they don't really simulate a lot of the drops most users experience which usually isn't hitting flat concrete over and over and over again it's people just dropping their phones on a table on the carpet on hardwood floor yes on uh cement tube on but on tile on all these different surfaces on different angles hitting all different sorts of things when you drop it I think out of all the drop test videos I watched Mobile reviews eh I hope I'm getting that right covered it the best with a lot more examples of different types of drops that most users would experience on a daily basis and if you watch this entire video in this video you will see the iPhone 15 Pro Glass does actually shatter on the bottom first after about 10 drops but if you look at the repeated drops also on the 14 pro it starts to look worse for wear basically as you go through the video you'll find advantages and disadvantages to the iPhone 15 Pro structural Integrity as well as with the iPhone 14 pro going over how stainless steel and titanium suffer damage but this video kind of illustrates another point that I think rarely gets taken into account with any glass device and that is really it all depends on how you drop your phone and how often you drop your phone you could drop a phone from really high up and literally suffer no damage sometimes but other times you can drop it from your pocket hit a corner or hit a rock the wrong way and all of a sudden your phone glasses just shattered also repeated drops of the phone does weaken the structural Integrity over time so you could drop your phone a few times and it could be perfectly fine look like you never dropped it but you could drop it from a similar height onto a similar surface and it could end up breaking even if it fell the exact same way just because you've dropped your phone so many times you compromised the structural Integrity of the device now is the iPhone 15 Pro less durable than the iPhone 14 pro or the pro Max I think the evidence does say yes particularly for the rear glass don't forget most of these tests had the front glass still intact so I don't think this is an issue solely from just the titanium frame because then both parts of the glass should be compromised in the same way so you might be wondering okay why is the rear glass breaking and the front glass seems to be just as okay as it was on the old iPhone 14 pro and that's the question I ask myself and I really think this has to do with the change that Apple made this year to repairability in short the iPhone 15 Pro is easier to repair this year because the backs are easier to detach they're kind of like not one cohesive unit like they were on the iPhone 14 pro this extra repairability has led to benefits though number one it's now easier to get to the back of the iPhone 15 Pro furthermore it's actually decreased what used to be a very expensive repair cost the iPhone 15 Pro now costs 169 dollars to repair without Apple Care and the back glass for the pro Max cost 200 hundred dollars compare that to the iPhone 14 pro which costs get this 500 to repair the back glass and the iPhone 14 pro Max costs 549 dollars to repair that same back glass now was this more repairable design worth it for the decreased protection it seems that the back glass has I guess that's on who you ask everyone has different priorities but so many people including a lot of the people doing these torture tests have advocated for more repairable iPhone designs and now that they get one they're complaining so it's kind of like you reap what you sow you ask for this stuff it's kind of like the cases like people are like don't use leather Apple then they come out with these new fine woven cases and now everyone's complaining that they're not as good as leather duh duh da da so you could go either way on if this back glass being more fragile is an issue to you but let's talk about the overheating Scandal because I think this one might turn out to be a non-issue so basically we had a lot of people talking about their iPhones overheating after they unboxed it don't forget as I'm making this video this iPhone isn't even a week old yet this is the sixth day that I am using it and most of these complaints stems from the first few days of iPhone unboxing during the initial setup this led some people to conclude that the a17 pro chip ran hot which actually it does it does seem to be true that at Peak Performance it consumes more power than the a16 pro but most people are not using the Peak Performance of the a17 pro chip when they're using their phone for normal tasks like taking video or going through Twitter right and these heat problems really seem to stem from artificial benchmarks another conclusion was that titanium dissipates heat less efficiently than stainless steel which is true and that is what is leading to the compromised thermal design but again I have to question how big of a deal this design decision is considering Apple isn't even using a full titanium frame here it's actually a mix of aluminum and titanium with the titanium just being on the outer side of the device away from the internals where the phone gets hot so realistically I have to ask how much is that thin layer of titanium really holding in all this extra heat I I really don't know and I do want to preface this saying I think we need some more time testing these devices to determine if there is an overheating problem but what I will say is that conducting these tests during the first few days of an iPhone purchase is disingenuous and that's because if you don't know when you first set up an iPhone it is running through a lot of background tasks like syncing your entire iCloud photo library running on device machine learning algorithms to find faces and photos or detecting depth data for editing portrait mode photos or indexing the search data on your phone so you can do Spotlight searches and you're probably also downloading a ton of apps right you just set up a new phone you're downloading all the old apps you had on your old phone and there's just other things that make your phone run hotter than it usually would on a normal day and it also drains your battery significantly during the setup that's why if you ever see someone review battery life on a new device without owning it for a full week you should never fully trust those results especially on day one especially on day one people are reviewing the battery on day one nonsense not to mention most people mentioned they noticed the heat on the first day while also charging their phone while using it all situations I faced in the past that would heat up any iPhone during setup any iPhone any iPhone would heat up during those conditions in fact this iPhone 15 Pro was hot during setup day but I didn't tweet or complain about it because this isn't my first rodeo I know iPhones heat up during the first few days and they drain battery faster during the first few days because of all that setup but now after six days of using this phone it doesn't overheat I've used it in my car for map directions while playing music I've used it to shoot photos and videos I even did a test recording of 4K prores file for 20 minutes I was like okay let me see can I can I overheat this thing and it didn't and others are basically seeing the same thing and Reporting no thermal issue after a few days of use could there be a thermal issue that I and others are not seeing yes it's totally possible like I said at the start I don't pretend to know everything I can only give you my own results from using these devices how I use them and as a blanket statement new designs usually aren't a complete net good or a net bad there's pros and cons to the way that things are designed and there's benefits like lower repair costs and there's disadvantages like the back of the glass maybe being easier to break than previous years ultimately as the customer you have the power to determine if those issues are real issues for you and if they are don't buy the product if they aren't and in if you're real World experience you aren't facing these issues then don't be scared of the product either and again if you are facing any of these problems and you're like my iPhone's overheating I don't know what Greg's talking about it's it's awful the camera's awful the titanium's scratched I I hate this phone then don't listen to me either go return the device right now when you still can don't hold on to the thing if you don't like it now to me this iPhone after using it for about a week it has a lot of benefits to the new design that I like even if I'm willing to make some of those trade-offs it's lighter it's more comfortable to hold the titanium looks great it feels great in the hands and this phone is Snappy and responsive with that a17 Pro chip and I really like the camera things I don't like about it are battery life which I'm hesitant to even really give a full opinion on right now because again I haven't used this for a full week just like I told you to be wary of but if you want to know my own personal experience with this iPhone 15 Pro Max battery is basically it's about the same as my 14 pro Max which did get me through a full day of usage but it didn't leave much room to spare and as the battery started to age on the 14 pro Max and it got less and less at the end of the day to the point where when you get to like 90 battery capacity maybe you have to charge it halfway through the day so for the 15 Pro Max I was hoping for better battery life so that wouldn't happen as the battery aged I'm not really seeing that so far in the 15 Pro Max seems to be about the same battery life as I was getting last year all right but what is the main point of this video listen I consider myself to be an apple Enthusiast I like Apple products I like a lot of other products too a good product is a good product and I judge them as I would any product because ultimately my allegiance is to you the viewer and also to my own personal Integrity myself if I recommend a product like this iPhone and it sucks and you have a terrible time with it and it snaps in half when you touch it wrong or it overheats and burns your hand like a McDonald's coffee why would you ever watch any of my videos ever again if I ever recommended a defective product like that I have no reason to lie to you about my own personal experience with this device and if I did lie to you it would only be to my own detriment I don't even have a personal connection with apple as a company they don't send me devices they don't pay me I pay them I buy all of these products every year and I don't return most of them it's an expense for this channel but what I do care about is accurate information and not jumping to conclusions for some reason I still care about integrity in a world that seems to care less and less about it it would probably be more beneficial for me if I jump to conclusions like everyone else out there to get more attention to get more views to Hype up these controversies to the point where you have reaction streamers reacting to them because we live in a fast-paced society and we move from controversy to controversy in days and because of that people forget people forget what you said and there's less and less accountability every day people want what happened to Lou they want 78 million views generated on an iPhone video that talks about how bad it is and people fall into that trap easily they make one video about the iPhone having an issue and suddenly they start getting views and then they make another video and it doesn't get views and that suddenly they go oh wait the when I talked about the iPhone stinking it got abuse so maybe I should do that again it happens I've seen it happen to multiple channels because iPhones like it or not they're a big topic for people who like Apple products and for people who don't like Apple products now to be fair that's not everyone there's a lot of credible and trusted channels out there but it is a big enough issue that I do see it and it warrants at least warning my viewers to get a second opinion and I say this even for my channel don't watch a Greg's gadgets video on an iPhone review and think that is it that is the definitive opinion that is the definitive review it is the best review ever it got nothing wrong no listen I am human I may have missed something I may have got something wrong I make mistakes all the time to get a really good idea of how a device works or if there's issues with it you should watch a few reviews from different channels and then make up your own mind because ultimately you the viewer are what matters it is your opinion it is your experience with these devices that matters if you have a bad experience with it or a good experience with it trust your gut okay let me have it in the comments I know I'm gonna get the usual right Apple Fanboy apple pays you Apple Defender all The Usual Suspects because it's another year it's another iPhone release and if you have even a slightly different opinion even though I think this video is pretty fair people get upset they're like why you don't completely agree with me Greg I'm upset at you you stink Greg cut your hair Greg style your hair differently Greg do this Greg do that Greg Greg Greg Greg I get it I get it I'm human why you gotta criticize me all the time why you gotta make fun of the way I say button button you don't think I see those comments I see all the comments criticizing me all the time you think it you think it doesn't affect me it doesn't I don't care keep criticizing me I like it I don't care it's YouTube you gotta have a thick skin to be in this game I got the thickest skin it's a little too thick I could afford to lose a little bit of weight that's a criticism I criticize myself all right have a good day I'll see you in the next one guys I love you

25.title: What I REALLY Think About the iPhone 15...
25.description: This is my review of the iPhone 15 in...green? Are you sure that's green, Apple? In any case, there are a lot of big upgrades ...
25.captions: I've been using the iPhone 15 over the past week and while it isn't perfect this is one of the biggest year-over-year upgrades that Apple has given to a base model iPhone in a very long time when you first open up the box the first thing that strikes you is just how soft it is that's honestly the best way to describe it especially if you've held an iPhone from the past few years the edges have been ever so slightly rounded and the back glass is this really soft matte texture that feels Pleasant to hold it's one of the nicest feeling phones that I've ever held actually and I'm not exaggerating at all the only thing I don't like about this design update is the color or rather the lack of color Apple calls this green and don't get me wrong I like green as you can clearly see but this iPhone is the color of my white shoes after I mow the lawn and that is not a good thing also in the Box you get a braided USB type-c cable for our brand new USBC iPhone 15. thank you Europe if we flip the phone over to the front you can see that we get the dynamic Island from the the iPhone 14 pro last year and this is actually a big upgrade for me all of the notifications now pop up and expand from there with lots of little neat animations and it also does have quite a bit of functionality attached to it with music playing and timers and whatnot yes it might feel a little bit gimmicky at first but there's one thing this island allows for that makes the whole thing worth it for me seamless custom icons because that shortcut pop-up now happens inside the dynamic Island you can have custom icons on the home screen without that annoying shortcut pop-up coming up if you want a tutorial on how to do this let me know in a comment down below the display has also been upgraded it now tops out at 1 000 nits of brightness for SDR content and then 2 000 nits of brightness with HDR and it is noticeably brighter outside I used it for navigation a ton on my trip this past weekend and I never had a problem seeing the screen even in direct sunlight the display is still running at 60 hertz though the high refresh rate displays have once again been saved for the pro model phones this year but that's totally fine this is a perfectly good display for most people the colors and contrast are fantastic and the stereo speakers are great as well the biggest upgrade though can you guess what it is well you're thinking about that USBC Port aren't you eh wrong it's actually the camera system the iPhone 15 gets the 48 megapixel main camera from the iPhone 14 pro which is actually huge I took a ton of photos and videos on my little trip over the past weekend and I was very impressed at the kind of images that you can get with this base model iPhone 15. the photos were sharp had very accurate colors for the most part and there was very minimal shutter lag present when pressing the capture button even in places where lighting wasn't the best the iPhone 15 still did pretty great and the Cinematic mode from the front-facing camera looks very solid too this Aviation Museum that I went to was incredible there were a ton of planes from many different eras and even when there wasn't a ton of light the iPhone 15 performed admirably there's some new software features too for example if I take a regular photo of something I can actually choose to turn it into a portrait mode photo later on the iPhone 15 will actually capture all of the depth information required in every single shot that you take so that you can change things up on the Fly after the fact that is awesome and it's something I think a lot of people will take advantage of apple has also given us a 2X option inside the camera app despite the fact that there's no telephoto in this phone because the main sensor is now a much higher resolution you can crop into it digitally without much of a loss it's definitely a good option to have but as you can see if you zoom in any further there there's a pretty big loss of detail it's certainly no substitute for Apple's new 5x Tetra prism telephoto lens that the pro Max gets this year the other two cameras on this phone the 12 megapixel ultrawide and the 12 megapixel front-facing camera have not been updated at least near as I can tell but image processing as a whole is going to be better because the iPhone 15 comes with the a16 bionic chip that was in the iPhone 14 pro last year and by this point I think you're starting to see a bit of a trend this is basically the iPhone 14 pro plus or minus a few things you get the dynamic Island the brighter screen the main camera and the a16 bionic from last year's profile you are losing the 120 hertz part of the display and the telephoto camera but you're gaining USBC and the new design unfortunately the USBC port in the iPhone 15 and iPhone 15 plus is limited to the exact same speeds as the lightning Port was so USB 2 speeds transferring files via cable is still going to be a pain wired charging is also pretty slow Apple claims that you're going to get like 50 of your battery back after 30 minutes on the charger and how is the old battery anyway well Apple didn't talk a lot about it in the keynote which led me to believe that it wasn't going to be very good and I wish I wasn't but I was kinda right if I have a busy day where I'm using the cameras a lot or I'm using the phone for navigation a ton I will definitely need to plug in and charge up before my day is over magsafe does make that a little bit easier with the plethora of magsafe battery packs that are available now but I still do wish that there was a bigger battery stuffed into here the iPhone 15 is a big upgrade over last year's 14. I actually think it's the biggest upgrade since the iPhone 12 and they're keeping the price the same this year it starts at 7.99 USD if you skipped upgrading to the 14 last year because it was a bit of an iterative update this actually might be the year for you to buy I do have a review coming on the iPhone 15 Pro as well so subscribe if you haven't already hope you liked the video thanks for watching and as always have a great day

28.title: Be gentle with Apples new Titanium iPhone 15 Pro Max ... Yikes!
28.description: Apples new iPhone 15 Pro Max FAILS my Durability Test! Grab a Ghost case for your iPhone HERE ...
28.captions: Apple's using Titanium on their newest iPhone 15 Pro Max titanium is the coolest metal on the planet for many reasons it's bio-compatible used for creating artificial joints repairing human bones not to mention build Interstellar spacecraft and to construct robots that crawl other planets and of course it's on my ring my ring has titanium that I reclaimed from a wheelchair titanium comes in quite a few different flavors grade 1 being the cheapest softest and easiest machine which is what I thought the iPhone was going to be but then Apple slapped a grade 5 on the screen and I got rocked in more ways than one and let me show you why foreign titanium bar stock laying around as people often do this guy costs 170 dollars for example this 6061 aluminum bar of the exact same proportions only cost me 10. aluminum is what smartphones are normally made from and the color difference between the two metals is glorious to behold especially as it's heated the main reason my Jerry rig knife is only 15 bucks is because I'm using an aluminum alloy and not a titanium alloy and keep in mind this solid Rod is only grade 2 titanium I'm too poor to buy a full Rod of grade 5 titanium since a single notepad sized paper thick sliver already cost 106 dollars all by itself if we do some simple math and scale this half millimeter thick piece of metal up to a hypothetical eight and a half millimeter block thick enough to Mill a phone out of we would be looking at almost two thousand dollars worth of grade 5 titanium and that's not even including the complexity of milling and shaping grade 5 and the dollars worth of iPhone Hardware that goes inside so the math just ain't mathon and there's no way Apple suddenly decided to make negative profit on each iPhone sold you might have noticed that titanium reacts in a very unique way as it gets torched oxidizing an extremely predictable and consistent rainbows going from yellow to purple to blue to light blue and back to gray again as it gets really hot you might be thinking to yourself hey Jerry are you even gonna unbox the iPhone and I say yes let's jump in and see what this iPhone is made from and also how well it can handle the uh the heat of everyday life hit that subscribe button if you haven't already and let's get started [Music] [Applause] [Music] inside the brand new iPhone 15 Pro max box we find the phone itself this blue titanium is almost the same shade as the blue titanium that I made looking under the phone this time we find there's no lightning cable instead we have a brand new braided USBC cable I imagine the world will soon follow Apple's lead on this one and we'll start seeing this port everywhere probably the closest thing we'll ever see to world peace and honestly the phone does feel good about the same as any other rectangular phone but the brushed titanium and the etch back glass do feel super cool but the imitation blue shade is just ever so much off from the actual shade of blue titanium that I think it would bother me long term Apple said again that this screen glass is the strongest glass ever on a smartphone they call it ceramic shield and I agree it is a pretty solid slab of glass we know see plastic screen scratch at a level two or three blasts at five or six and Sapphire would be an eight or nine this dual ion exchange ceramic Shield does still scratch at level 6 with deeper grooves at a level 7 but level 6 does appear to be quite a bit more faint than usual and I do think apple is onto something with this proprietary glass the front selfie camera is tucked into the dynamic Island and is protected by that same slab of glass the earpiece is a razor thin slit between the glass and the frame no speaker grilles to fall out or get dirty making our way over to the titanium sides apples using something called a PVD coating a physical vapor deposition it's a pretty wild method of applying an ultra thin protective layer over the titanium I don't know enough about PVD to talk about it in depth but you know it is scratchable exactly like the anodized aluminum everything except for this 5G antenna slot for some reason this oval is just not scratching I think they should make a whole phone out of whatever this stuff is the power button is scratchable however and not removable along with the top and entire left side it took Apple 14 hours to apply this finish and my Jerry rig knife 14 seconds to unapply the Finish the new action button is scratchable and our USBC Port down near the bottom is an actual USB 3 with 10 gigabit transfer speeds the regular iPhone 15 is just USB 2 and if you don't know what that means you'll be just fine with either the matte back glass which every phone should have does not scratch the Apple logo in the center is the only thing that's smooth one thing that Apple did change up quite a bit this year is with the cameras we still get that gradual gradient built into the tinted glass that rises up to the camera plateau and some of these camera upgrades we won't be able to see until the teardown but Apple says these three lenses that we can see are actually seven got a LOL a bit of that absolute stretch here at the bottom we have a 48 megapixel main camera which apparently has a nano scale coating on the lens to reduce glare the coating luckily does not scratch off or fracture the coolest camera is definitely the middle one a 12 megapixel 5 times Tetra prism telephoto lens that redirects and reflects light four times before hitting a 3D sensor shift OAS stabilizer if there's one reason to take apart the iPhone 15 Pro Max it's to see what in the world that looks like from the inside then up top we have a 12 megapixel ultrawide apparently these two cameras on the edge can work together like two eyeballs to generate spatial video which I don't want to be the guy to beat a dead horse but that was something Android did 12 years ago with the HTC EVO 3D probably before some of you kidlets with iPhones were even born gotta honor your ancestors Apple said during their event that the back glass panel is easily removable to facilitate repairability which is a huge commendable move and then in the same sentence Apple said that the internal structure of the iPhone 15 Pro Max is made from 100 recycled aluminum which immediately tells us two things one it's nice to see that there's more than just the iPhone design that gets recycled every year and two the internal frame is not solid grade 5 titanium only the exterior this explains quite a bit the iPhone 15 Pro Max has a 6.7 inch OLED display with 2 000 nits of outdoor brightness and 120 hertz refresh rate and lasts for about Infinity seconds before having no reaction to my lighter nice work Apple we'll try out my uh big boy lighter in a second it's time to see if the new Blended aluminum titanium grafted hybrid structure compromises the structural Integrity of the iPhone 15 Pro Max yeah I'm gonna be honest I did not see that one coming you've been watching me durability test smartphones for about 11 years now and most phones do not break iPhones especially do not break like ever and that snap was abnormally quick kinda stunned I'm not sure if it's because the grade 5 titanium frame has nearly three times more tensile strength than aluminum or half the elasticity but the glass did not like being pressed or flexed by my thumb that's crazy on the first bin too internally the phone itself is doing fine of course there's no cracking or shattering of the frame but the back glass is definitely obliterated good thing Apple made the glass modular so it only cost 200 bucks to replace instead of 500 but still if I was a person who just purchased a twelve hundred dollar titanium iPhone 15 Pro Max I would be extremely nervous right now anyway I did not plan on that happening but you gotta admit the crack looks pretty cool the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max does not survive my durability test which means it's time for the big boy lighter the PVD coating is already an imitation blue which would make any actual doing the titanium brain very difficult to see but if we sand it down and expose some bearish titanium we might be able to see if Apple's grade 5 reacts the same way as my grade 5. that's some pretty good looking brush titanium still not sure why it takes Apple 14 hours I'm using a map gas torch which I think along with burning my desk is actually lighting some of the titanium dust on fire you can see the Sparks glow white as they sputter away from the phone now the titanium itself could probably handle the heat but the screen and the phone circuitry not so much the torch definitely accomplishes what my lighter could not and if we look super close at the iPhone frame we can see it start to change colors from the heat apple is indeed using real titanium is it grade 5 though I do have ways of finding out I think it's getting kind of hot in here and now everyone knows the whole point of getting a new iPhone is so that everyone knows you have a new iPhone hiding it in a black plastic case would holy and entirely defeat the purpose and wow side note natural titanium is the move for sure however getting a transparent case to show off your phone is dangerous since most clear cases are made of thermoplastic polyurethane which when exposed to ultraviolet radiation undergoes the irreversible process of photooxidation sunlight makes clear cases turn yellow so on the off chance you ever do go outside you won't have a clear case anymore enter my channel sponsor dbrand dbrand has inexplicably found a way to defeat the sun with their never yellowing completely transparent ghost case and they're offering free Replacements if it ever does yellow which is pretty brave of them the best part is the ghost case is also completely compatible with my tear down skin you can keep your own phone from getting absolutely wrecked like mine with the link down in the description now I pride myself on being extremely thorough and I'd be a Miss if we let this golden opportunity to check the back glass the regular iPhone 15 Pro for similar structural deficiencies as its larger counterpart with some very strong bins from the back nothing happens flipping the phone over to the front again nothing happens the normal sized iPhone 15 Pro survives and does not have the same fate as the max I'm curious to see how thin Apple's titanium layer actually is and what grade it is the iPhone 15 Pro Max teardown is going to be quite a bit more destructive than usual thank you for subscribing and thank you for watching I'll see you around

if I show you what I'm looking at you can see this is my producer James with the 15 Pro recording his new 4k 60 prores onto an SSD plugged into the USB port so for me actually the new USB C Port is first time on new iPhone 15 Pros you can also Now record in HDR and log now I still don't think an iPhone is going to replace your fancy mirrorless or DSLR camera but you know often the best camera is the one you have in your pocket it's a good tool to have although I would be it's kind of surprised if my I don't know professional wedding videographer turned up to my wedding shooting on an iPhone but with the new options you have with the higher quality video and photos which we'll come back to in a second oh I just got bright it's a pretty big step up anyway enough about prores the headline upgrade with the new 15 series is the switch to USBC the ubiquity the universality of USBC how every MacBook iPad well except the cheapest 9th gen model every Windows laptop Android phone and every charging port in new cars they're all type c and while you could faff around with adapters or just rely on wireless charging and airdrop going forward it means if you run out of battery on your iPhone 15 and your friends or Android then you can use the same charging cable and vice versa now I had hoped the switch to USBC may have meant we'd also get faster charging but alas no still tops out 20 watts with Apple's charger which of course doesn't come bundled in the Box although you do get the nice CTC braided cable now and also the regular 15s not the pros actually have a USB 2.0 spec rather launch an app although I reckon for most of us myself included you'll just make it the shortcut for the camera and then it also acts as a shutter button yes the volume down does also work as a shutter this does feel noticeably nippier more responsive apps seem to load Just a Touch quicker and also I haven't had any of those sort of random slowdowns or stuff says that did occasionally crop up on my 14 pro it's also a big deal because the 15 Pros are the only phones for now at least that will run these upcoming console level games this does now support Wi-Fi 6E although you will of course need a last week so they're all brand new like the 15s although more importantly what I'm very keen to see is how the battery health fares over time because my iPhone 14 pro Max which I've been using for a long time that degradation in battery capacity is a lot faster it's more significant so I'm hoping there's improvements with this obviously it'll take a while to figure that out trying to get a photo no more I'm out if I bring up the camera specs for both you can see the main Hardware change this year is that the optical zoom with the pro Max is getting a new five times telephoto whereas the pro is sticking with three times aside from that the hardware is pretty similar same sensors and same resolutions as last year's 14 Pros however there is more to the story with some pretty big software and processing improvements for example the iPhone 15 Pros now combine your usual four into one pixel bins 12 megapixel photo with a full fat 48 megapixel photo giving us a more detailed 24 megapixel shot and also despite having double the megapixels the file size of each photo is only about 50 bigger Apple have also introduced three different focal length options for the main camera so you've got the default one times which is 24 millimeters tap once for 28 and tap again for 35 equivalent to a 1 1.2 and 1.5 times optical zoom using some clever cropping of that 48 megapixel sensor this is definitely aimed at more Enthusiast photographers who have a particular focal length in mind although it's a shame these new focal length options don't transfer over to video but I reckon one of the most exciting new features is how even in the regular photo mode if the camera detects a face a cat or a dog or even if you just simply tap on a subject it will now capture a depth map so you can actually turn this regular photo into a portrait where you can then adjust the bokeh level and also the focal point so if you see this little f-stop icon pop up then you know it's capturing the portrait info and you can tap it if you want to preview that bokeh and then if you press edit on the photo there is this new portrait button that turns it into a portrait with that tasty background blur so the idea is you don't have to worry about whether I should take a regular photo or a portrait which previously had higher shutter lag and missed out on Smart HDR because now with these next Generation portraits as Apple calls it portraits now use the same photonic engine pipeline so their fancy background processing as a regular photo so there's no compromise in quality or shutter lag and for me this is one of the most significant camera upgrades this year night mode shots as well as the new portraits also benefit from Apple's fancy photonic engine and deep Fusion processing now and according to Apple we're looking at up to two times better low light quality and the latest smart hdr5 processing should improve dynamic range color and detail across all cameras and modes up front we have the same 12 megapixel true depth selfie camera as before but this also gets next-gen portraits so again your regular selfies can now be turned into portraits after the fact plus we get all the benefits of that new smart hdr5 as for video the main difference now is that you can shoot that prores at 4k60 we have new log and HDR options and the video quality particularly low light should be improved now usually the selfie camera gets forgotten uh in many phones but not so much with the iPhone and also not so much with video and actually this can also shoot a 4k60 also known prores with login HDR yes it's lower megapixel than a rear camera but it has pretty much all the same features as well as small HDR and the next gen portraits for photos so all that sounds great but is the camera quality really that much better than last year well let me show you a few side by sides and also make sure you have subscribed as I have a full camera comparison with the Galaxy s23 Ultra in the works but my takeaway is that there isn't a huge amount in it I think the most obvious change is how the 15 Pros lean towards a warmer white balance which I would say is a little bit more accurate some shots are also noticeably less over sharpened some photos on the 14s look like someone's just turned the clarity slider up in Lightroom too far now photos look more natural and actually if we crop in so just literally pinch in on that one time shot you can see there is more detail and that's thanks to the new 48 plus 12 megapixel combined shot although on the face of it you may be hard-pressed and noticed now to answer the question of is the 15 Pro Max's Zoom better than the pros well it comes down to what you want really so between 1 and 2.9 times Zoom they're basically the same between 3 and 4.9 the pro wins but then 5 to 25 times the Promax wins makes sense given the hardware and of course in an Ideal World we'd see the pro Max with four lenses like the s23 ultra so there isn't a compromise but the question is do you prefer a three times portrait or a five times portrait 84 millimeters or 120. you can obviously shoot both on both phones although the quality isn't going to be the same and the real world difference with the pro Max is that you just have to take two or three steps back what you can now do as my cameraman James is demonstrating is Jump between all the different lenses while shooting at 4K 60. previously you couldn't go to ultra Wide Auto photo depending on which one you started with but now at the highest resolution and frame rate you can switch between them all and I'm kind of curious how it looks going between those lenses just darting in and out obviously I can't see but hopefully you'll let me know in the comments what do you think how's that five times stability although I had hoped they'd have made some changes and upgrades to the Cinematic Mode still stuck to 4K 30 no prores or log options it still looks pretty good particularly in nice lighting but there is no kind of new next-gen mode of cinematic where if you shoot regular video you can then add depth stuff afterwards maybe next year I'm also pleased to see that they have slightly reduced the lens flare it's definitely still there and we get those sort of light floaters as I call them but in this particular shot you can no longer see the camera lens outline but what do you think of this new camera system would it tempt you to upgrade another upgrade is actually the price it's now cheaper or at least here in the UK Apple always set their prices by US Dollars first and then look at other currencies and adjust for inflation and tax and things but the iPhone 15 the regular one is actually 50 pounds cheaper now in the UK starting at 799 down from 849 the 15 Pro is 100 quid cheaper it's now starting at 999 rather than 1099 and the 15 Pro Max is actually the same price 11.99 but now with 256 gigs of storage anyway let's wrap up this review should you buy a 15 pro and pro Max well it all depends if you do an upgrade how old is your current phone I reckon anyone with an iPhone 11 or older yes go for it in terms of the Pro versus the pro Max for me it comes down to the bigger battery that's why I want this guy and also I prefer the bigger screen which is actually now a lot more comfortable to use because of the sort of smaller form factor but I reckon even if as a package it's not that significantly different from 14 pro Max the there are lots of nice incremental upgrades and as I say with the pro GPU with USBC this is kind of like the new Baseline for iPhones if you buy anything older without USBC you can restricted to last gen stuff but what do you reckon are you tempted to upgrade have you already ordered one let me know what you make of the new 15 Pros in the comments below thank you so much for watching guys and I'll see you next time right here on the tech chat

looks a lot cooler but something that annoys me about my black iPhone 11 is that in dark rooms or dark environments it becomes near impossible to tell if you're holding the front of the phone up or the back of the phone and also for thermal limitations I want to get more lighter toned iPhones if they had a white one or a silver one I would buy diets and they technically do they just for some reason call it blue you know they could have probably easily called this a white iPhone and people would just say oh it has a slightly cooler color temperature to it but I don't think it's necessarily the most Financial responsible thing to do to buy a brand new iPhone on launch day because that's when it's gonna be the most expensive and now that there's ways in settings to check the cycle count 39.title: iPhone 15 Pro & 15 Pro Max One Week Later - Worth it??
39.description: This is a review of the new iPhone 15 Pro and the iPhone 15 Pro Max. In this review, I go over my experience with the iPhone 15 ...
39.captions: so it's official after many rumors leaks and town right impatience the iPhone 15 Pro and the 15 Pro Max are officially here and man out the gate orders came flying in for these phones not too long after pre-ordering was made available shipping dates started getting pushed up by months and man there were lines at Apple Stores across the Globe last Friday with hundreds of people hoping they could get their hands on one of these popular devices to avoid long shipping delays and I'm happy to say that I was lucky enough to get my hands at both the iPhone 15 Pro and the 15 Pro Max on the first day it was made available and I've been using both for about a week now and I gotta say it's been an interesting experience so far Apple made some really unique choices this year for their beloved smartphone and a part of me could understand the initial draw for many people looking to upgrade this year but honestly there's another side of me that feels as though these phones are a bit underwhelming and let's start with the first real major change that the iPhone 15 Pro and the 15 Pro Max bring to the table and that's its build material taking a page out of the Apple watch ultra's Playbook Apple decided to forego the use of stainless steel the premium material is using on its Pro iPhone for quite some time now and use titanium instead generally speaking titanium is a significantly stronger metal in comparison to aluminum and even stainless steel which in theory should help mitigate damage to the iPhone's frame now I will say it doesn't make the glass flanking the funner back of the phone any stronger so keep that in mind it's still using Apple's ceramic Shield which is pretty strong for glass but you're still going to want to make sure you do everything in your power not to drop by the phone on the concrete early stress tests are not looking good for this phone but the use of titanium is a welcome change here it has a much nicer brushed finish as opposed to the reflective polished one they've used before and they're nicely color matched to the new iPhone colorways I've got the 15 Pro Max and the new blue titanium that looks incredibly Sleek very beautiful in person and I've got the 15 Pro Max in this new natural titanium color and has this industrial look to it as the phone is supposed to resemble basically a slab of metal I think the titanium looks the best in this particular colorway it's less fingerprint and smudge prone and overall it's one of the most unique looking iPhones to date and to me it's not necessarily the strength titanium that makes it appealing but rather the added benefit of making this phone significantly lighter titanium is fantastic because it offers exceptional toughness and protection without making your device feel like a tank this is a big deal for me as a pro Max user since the iPhone 13 Pro Max I've always felt as though the pro Max variants were too heavy to the point where holding them for extended periods of time would start to get fatiguing and uncomfortable so the 15 Pro and the 15 Pro Max being much lighter is a big plus here another part of the older design that contributed to the discomfort was the way that the stainless steel frame integrated into the glass it was completely squared off at a 90 degree angle so not only did it make the big phone harder to grip it kind of felt like the frame was almost digging into your palm so in an effort to make the 15 Pro lineup more comfortable Apple ever so slightly rounded off the frame so it's easier to hold it's very hard to notice just by looking at it but it is a better feeling in the hand overall but aside from the new build material and the new colors there's really not much else that has changed with the 15 Pro when talking form factor and I'm just gonna say it's kind of disappoint pointing I was really hoping for more of an overhaul to this look that the iPhone has had since basically the iPhone 12 and even though there's nothing wrong with it it is starting to get a little old there was so much hype going into this drop as this was supposed to be the year for the makeover and I just feel as though we got more of the same though the minor updates have made the 15 Pro and the 15 Pro Max enjoyable to use one week later they're undeniably familiar devices that have left me wanting more from a design standpoint now yes the iPhone 15 Pro and the 15 Pro Max didn't usher in the facelift we all wanted but it did bring in some much needed changes from a functionality standpoint that I think are really important number one after many years of Apple essentially saying Fu to everyone it finally folded and made the entire iPhone lineup compatible with USB type-c not because they wanted to no they would have forced fetus lightning for eternity if they could it took the European Union to essentially Force Tim Cook into submission now this is great because most modern devices in general use USB type-c now so it should make it a lot simpler to charge your iPhone the Pro Models also come with added functionality with this part as it can support USB 3 data transfer speeds of up to 10 gigabits per second this allows you to very quickly transfer stuff off your phone onto say a computer but also the opportunity for more unique things like recording 4K 60 frames per second in HDR prores by connecting the phone to a portable SSD we'll get into the camera features in just a bit but this is a useful feature if you're really into shooting video with a mobile device the other new feature that's the first for the iPhone is again inspired by the Apple watch Ultra and that's the addition of the action button it replaced the silent switch on the iPhone which I'm not realizing has been on every iPhone ever I think and don't worry if you love the silent switch the action button by default is set to silent and unsign on your phone when you press it but you can now have the luxury of mapping that button to a specific action of your choice and apple went all out on this UI for setting this up and provides some really great options for you to choose from like activating the camera starting a voice memo and my personal favorite which is to run a shortcut this option basically allows you to map the app button to virtually any function on the iPhone given that you know how to use shortcuts I have mine set to unlock my Tesla which is great because there are times where my Bluetooth connection doesn't automatically unlock my doors when I'm walking up to the car so being able to press the action button quickly to unlock is so clutch it's like having a traditional key fob baked into my phone but let's talk about performance on the iPhone 15 Pro this is the first iPhone using Apple's new Pro chip as it's powered by the a17 pro and apple did go into specifics about how this new chipset allows users to not only do things like play console level games but also gain maximum efficiency for things like better battery life and has to be expected from a day-to-day perspective both phones have been performing great everything is Silky Smooth when navigating around the OS Pro motion continues to deliver especially on these displays that have a slightly smaller bezel than before though I haven't been able to test any of the console games the mobile games that I usually play that are relatively spec intensive all perform great and was especially enjoyable in the Pro Max with this larger screen now throughout all this I've been very closely monitoring thermals of both bones there's been a lot of chatter of people experiencing overheating issues with the 15 Pro I did feel the phone get pretty warm the very first day I set up my 15 Pro Max which was concerning but after I did the software update to iOS 17.02 it seemed to have resolved the issue and as far as what my battery life has been one week later this was a big Focus area for me because my battery life in the 14 pro Max has just been terrible if I'm being honest I'm happy to say it's noticeably better I know it's only been a week but I almost got through two full days of modern use on a full charge with my 15 Pro Max very much mirroring the impeccable battery performance I have with 13 Pro Max and it's been a breath of fresh air to say the least Mr who's the boss just did His Brilliant battery test of the new 15 lineup and the results showed the 15 Pro Max doing very well now the regular Pro didn't do as good on this test but so far my experience has been pretty solid I got almost a day and a half on a full charge now I know it's early and I'm definitely knocking on wood here but so far the battery life out the gate seems to be way better than when I was getting on the 14 Pros now let's talk about cameras one of the most important areas of performance and it's really interesting we're starting to see some differentiation happen between the 15 Pro and the 15 Pro Max though they both come with four cameras total three on the back and one in the front the regular pro has a three times optical zoom lens similar to last year while the pro Max has a new five times optical zoom using a new terrapism design Apple also equipped this particular camera with its 3D sensorship technology which gives users some pretty insane stabilization you can also adjust the focal length settings on the main camera now which is a pretty nifty tool if you're a serious photo shooter so a lot of the features associated with the cameras on the iPhone 15 Pro are becoming more and more Pro like for enthusiasts and Beyond which is really interesting and generally speaking the still images coming out of all the pro cameras are fantastic as to be expected they're tack sharp even if you punch in with the help of the larger sensors colors are accurate and natural looking while still giving excellent dynamic range and I gotta say the portrait shots so far looking excellent speaking of portrait shots a new software feature app Apple introduced with the iPhone 15 is the ability to turn any picture of a person or pen into a portrait picture even if you didn't select portrait mode all you have to do is Select portrait here in the camera app and it'll automatically adjust the photo to a portrait mode one you can also edit the focus Point as well which is kind of sick this is really impressive in terms of processing power the camera has to be taking in a crap ton of data when you press the shutter button in order to have this capability and even though I think it's more of a parlor trick than a feature that will actually be used often No Lie it is pretty cool now where Apple really shines is with its video quality it's so far ahead of the competition and I'm happy to say it keeps pulling forward with what the 15 Pro and the 15 Pro Max can do when it comes to video much like the still image capabilities Apple seems to be making a concerted effort around giving users pro-like features when it comes to video as you can now shoot at up to 4K 60 in prores so long as you have an external SSD attached to the phone as well as the ability to shoot in a log profile now if you're not a camera nerd like me the simplest way to explain what log profile is it's basically a video format that gives you a very flat unsaturated file but loaded with a ton of Digital Data this gives you way more flexibility in the edit when it comes to color grading to create a more specific look without compromising the quality of the video and it's pretty nuts and a smartphone is actually able to do this now that said I'm pretty sure 99 of people will never use this feature because long footage on its own is not flattering at all it requires some sort of editing which is not the simplest thing to do so again very much geared towards pros and enthusiasts but don't let that worry you out the box the regular 4K footage on the 15 Pro looks amazing without question the best video coming out of any smartphone period and to me it's still the biggest Flex for the iPhone in terms of its process and that brings me to My overall thoughts on the iPhone 15 Pro and the 15 Pro Max one week later and here's the thing I think this is Apple's best effort to truly make these devices Pro devices but in that regard it kind of caters to that one percent of people that actually identify as a pro the beastly a17 Pro chip and how it's being leveraged here to give users the ability to play advanced games or have really robust computational photography features or the ability to shoot MOG all of these things are amazing but most will go completely unused by the average consumer with the 15 Pro in his or her hand and if you take those new features away you're honestly not left with anything too exciting with this new offering and because of that I'm a bit more inclined to recommend the non-pro iPhone 15s this year for most people now the pro solid phones one week later everything seems to indicate yes but I'm gonna have to do a lot more long-term testing to really pressure test how it's going to perform over time so make sure that you're subscribed to the channel so
